author: rootsid
title: KERI bridge for Cardano
description: KERI is a breakthrough technology considered to be the first truly decentralized identity system that is ledger-portable. Can Cardano be the first KERI Witness network on a major blockchain?

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has provided a clear description of the issue they are trying to solve: KERI, a decentralized identity system that is ledger-portable doesn't exist on Cardano.

As a solution to the problem, the proposer offers to develop the first implementation of a witness for key event logs, making Cardano a secondary root of trust.

The problem statement defines a problem within the challenge which needs to be solved. The proposal is likely to have a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem, making Cardano the first blockchain to operate a KERI Witness network. While bringing new exciting technologies to Cardano should be welcomed, it is, however, difficult to know the size of the target audience and how many users will end up using the solution. Finally, note that the bridge is a proof of concept, not production. Additional funding will be required.

I think this proposal addresses the challenge effectively. 4/5.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers provided a short description of who will work on the project, Rodolfo Miranda and Lance Byrd, including their roles, experiences, and past work. They have Cardano/Catalyst/Atala Prism qualifications and have successfully completed past Catalyst proposals in FUND 6 to 8. There is therefore complete confidence that the team can bring this proposal to term. They will be supported by the creator of KERI, Sam Smith, Ph.D. 

The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items (Research Technology, Deploy KERI agent, Develop PoC, documentation). Additional funding is required to bring the proposal to production. The budget (16K$) and the timetable (3 months) seem to be reasonable to achieve the set goals. The proposer provided a detailed roadmap for this proposal as well as a list of actionable tasks to complete. Given the experience and plan presented, it is very likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provided a clear and detailed roadmap and a time horizon for achievement (3 months to understand the tech and build a POC). The KPIs that define the success of the proposal are presented and make sense but it would have been nice to see the following KPIs: number of KERI projects reached out to and attracted to Cardano. The plan presented however is sufficient for the community to track the progress of the proposal. I rate auditability a 5/5.

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge by creating a safe and secure way for individuals to verify their legal identities in transactions, not just for Cardano, but that can work with any blockchain. This is the truest sense of interoperability: when the user can seamlessly move between chains unbeknownst to them. Integrating the Key Event Receipt Infrastructure (KERI) into the RootsWallet will allow users to remove the need for useless middlemen and replace it with the blockchain. As witnesses are required for many different types of transactions, having a constant and stable source to use at all times is likely a huge relief. 

This ease of interoperability also will provide an onboarding ramp to users who may be using KERI but not on Cardano. By marrying these two technologies, there may be an abundance of use cases that have not yet been explored, such as in the DeFi space.

f6_assessments.q2:
Yes, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. The RootsWallet is an open sourced project and the team provides constant commits and updates via github. The integration of the KERI feature will also be conducted in this fashion. 

This open-by-default approach is very welcome and can give voters confidence that the team is open to constructive criticism. The team also has a good track record of reporting on their progress and is likely to continue doing so.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is that KERI is a breakthrough technology considered to be the first truly decentralized identity system that is ledger-portable. Can Cardano be the first KERI Witness network on a major blockchain? Key Event Receipt Infrastructure ( KERI ) is the first truly decentralized identity system (https://keri.one/). Based on a log of self-confirmed cryptographic key events, it creates a decentralized secure root of trust that does not need a ledger or moreover a portable ledger which means its identifiers are not locked with any given blockchain and are switchable as needed. In other words, the KERI identifier is indeed portable. It is therefore considered a breakthrough technology being applied in major projects such as the Global Legal Identity Organization (GLEIF), which works with partners to grant millions of unique identities to legal entities participants in financial transactions around the world. This project is about implementing a bridge between KERI and Cardano event logs to act as a Witness in each transaction. Activities require two main activities:
-Understand technology (with paper)
-Familiar with available implementations
-Develop a proof-of-concept bridge component into the Cardano blockchain. Code will be Open Source
RootsID will work closely with the team behind KERI to develop the first witness implementation for key event logs, making Cardano a secondary source of trust.
